intro: Phaiophleps biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered phaiophleps, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring two distinct flower clusters on each inflorescence. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in lowland and hill forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in its moist habitat. Due to habitat destruction, Phaiophleps biflora is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
